title: UCLA Projects
text:
Analyzed Sleep Health and Lifestyle dataset to assess how lifestyle variables affect sleep duration.

Explored relationships using linear regression, power transformations, and model diagnostics to improve predictive accuracy.

Built and refined multiple models (full, stepwise, and best subset) using transformed predictors to address non-linearity and heteroscedasticity.

Key findings: Higher sleep quality and physical activity are positively associated with sleep duration, while age and daily steps show negative associations.

Demonstrated expertise in model selection, residual analysis, and interpreting multivariable regression output.

Completed analysis using R.

Here is my Project 1

title: UCLA Projects
section: Language in Earnings Reports and Stock Movement — Research Project, UCLA – Econ 188C
text:
Language in Earnings Reports and Stock Movement — Research Project, UCLA – Econ 188C
Investigated the relationship between CEO language in earnings call transcripts and short-term stock price movements using NLP techniques.

Collected 56 earnings call transcripts from 7 companies over 2 years; filtered for CEO-prepared script only.

Applied TF–IDF, chi-square keyness testing, and word embedding (GloVe) for feature extraction and classification.

Built supervised classifiers using Random Forest and evaluated models using confusion matrices (TF–IDF model reached 63.64% accuracy).

Implemented BERTopic for unsupervised topic clustering.

Found that confident language correlated with stock price increases, while vague terms correlated with decreases.

Identified seasonal patterns: Q4 earnings calls (Jan–Feb) often followed by price increases; Q1 calls (April) by decreases.
